item.title: Installing K3s with embedded etcd on RaspberryPi 4
item.description: Today we will use k3sup to install k3s onto our Raspberry Pi 4s. To install this tool on macOS we can simply use Homebrew: brew install k3sup Next, we will use Balena Etcher. This is a handy tool for flashing images to usb devices and such. It’s avaliable on Homebrew under the cask balenaetcher. brew install balenaetcher To install Ubuntu on our Raspberry Pi, head over to the Ubuntu Raspberry Pi downloads page, and grab the latest .
